The order of the polynomial used to fit the samples.
The order of the derivative to compute. This must be a nonnegative integer. The default is 0, which means to filter the data without differentiating.

Value to fill past the edges of the input if
Apply a Savitzky-Golay filter to an array.
Filter with a window length of 5 and a degree 2 polynomial.  Use the defaults for all other parameters.
Note that the last five values in x are samples of a parabola, so when mode='interp' (the default) is used with polyorder=2, the last three values are unchanged. Compare that to, for example,

signature.value: savgol_filter(x, window_length, polyorder, deriv=0, delta=1.0, axis=-1, mode='interp', cval=0.0)
